Market trends
‚Ä¢ Dollar under pressure: CTAs and other systematic funds continue to sell USD, according to BofA, putting sustained pressure on the dollar index. A weaker dollar directly supports gold by making it cheaper for non-USD buyers.
‚Ä¢ Broad metals rally: both gold and silver are printing records, underscoring robust demand for the entire precious-metals complex as an alternative to traditional assets.

Techs
Support: around recent breakout zones (just below the new highs) as the market searches for a new equilibrium
Resistance: open-ended at fresh record levels; any pause or pullback is likely to define the next support band

Equities

‚Ä¢ Ratings: UK silver producer Fresnillo receives a rating update from a major investment bank, signaling ongoing reassessment of valuations across the space.

‚Ä¢ Comparative pitch: Armstrong also stresses BTC‚Äôs divisibility and convenience versus gold, trying to frame it as a complementary savings tool rather than a direct competitor.

That could ultimately support both gold and BTC as hedges, but in the near term it reinforces the preference for the more established safe haven: physical gold.

‚Ä¢ USD (DXY): whether systematic selling persists, continued dollar weakness is the key short-term driver for gold.
